Pad a string

Source: R/pad.r
str_pad.Rd

Vectorised over string, width and pad.

Usage

str_pad(
  string,
  width,
  side = c("left", "right", "both"),
  pad = " ",
  use_length = FALSE
)

Arguments

string

A character vector.

width

Minimum width of padded strings.

side

Side on which padding character is added (left, right or both).

pad

Single padding character (default is a space).

use_length

If TRUE, use the number of characters instead of the total of character widths (see stringi::stri_width).

Value

A character vector.

See also

str_trim() to remove whitespace; str_trunc() to decrease the maximum width of a string.

Examples

rbind(
  str_pad("hadley", 30, "left"),
  str_pad("hadley", 30, "right"),
  str_pad("hadley", 30, "both")
)
#>      [,1]                            
#> [1,] "                        hadley"
#> [2,] "hadley                        "
#> [3,] "            hadley            "

# All arguments are vectorised except side
str_pad(c("a", "abc", "abcdef"), 10)
#> [1] "         a" "       abc" "    abcdef"
str_pad("a", c(5, 10, 20))
#> [1] "    a"                "         a"           "                   a"
str_pad("a", 10, pad = c("-", "_", " "))
#> [1] "---------a" "_________a" "         a"

# Longer strings are returned unchanged
str_pad("hadley", 3)
#> [1] "hadley"
